result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly A Werner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Credit for 56 days, if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain Absolute sobriety.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Regularly attend self help group meetings like Alcoholics Anonymous or similar.
Follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.
Case 16CM53 was dismissed and read into: 15CM2402.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.

Defendant Kelly A Werner in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. State presents arguments. Court grants the motion and modified the bail.  Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to find out the status of her other file from Jefferson County. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
